intro: Daviesia mollis var. minor, commonly known as the small-flowered Daviesia, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. This variety is often found in coastal and heathland environments.
